name: Taj Mahal
description: An ivory-white marble mausoleum on the right bank of the river Yamuna in Agra.

name: India Gate
description: A war memorial located astride the Rajpath, on the eastern edge of the 'ceremonial axis' of New Delhi.

name: Hawa Mahal
description: A palace in Jaipur, known as the 'Palace of Winds' with its unique five-story exterior.

name: Charminar
description: An iconic 16th-century mosque with four grand arches, located in Hyderabad.

name: Gateway of India
description: A monumental arch overlooking the Arabian Sea, built during the 20th century in Mumbai.

name: Mysore Palace
description: A historical palace in Mysore, known for its architectural grandeur and cultural significance.

name: Sun Temple, Konark
description: A 13th-century temple dedicated to the sun god, renowned for its intricate stone carvings.

name: Victoria Memorial
description: A large marble building in Kolkata, built between 1906 and 1921 in memory of Queen Victoria.

name: Golden Temple
description: The holiest Gurdwara of Sikhism, located in the city of Amritsar.

name: Meenakshi Temple
description: A historic Hindu temple located on the southern bank of the Vaigai River in Madurai.

name: Sri Venkateswara Temple
description: A temple dedicated to Lord Venkateswara, situated on the Tirumala Hills in Andhra Pradesh.

name: Nalanda University
description: An ancient center of learning, founded in the 5th century, now in ruins.

name: Rann of Kutch
description: A large salt desert, known for its white landscape, located in the western part of India.

name: Surajkund Mela
description: A popular international crafts mela held annually, showcasing global craftsmanship.

name: The Ridge
description: A large open space in Shimla, known for its scenic views and cultural significance.

name: Dal Lake
description: A picturesque lake surrounded by the beautiful Himalayan mountains in Srinagar.

name: Betla National Park
description: A renowned national park located in the Palamau region, famous for its wildlife.

name: Fort Kochi
description: A historic district in Kochi, known for its colonial architecture and cultural heritage.

name: Kanha National Park
description: One of the largest and most renowned national parks in central India, home to the Bengal tiger.

name: Loktak Lake
description: The largest freshwater lake in northeastern India, known for its floating islands.

name: Cherrapunji
description: A town famous for its heavy rainfall, living root bridges, and scenic landscapes.

name: Reiek Mountain
description: A popular trekking destination offering panoramic views of the surrounding valleys.

name: Kohima
description: The capital city of Nagaland, known for its scenic hills and historical significance.

name: Konark Sun Temple
description: A 13th-century sun temple dedicated to Surya, known for its architectural excellence.

name: Auroville
description: An international township dedicated to human unity, located near Puducherry.

name: Khangchendzonga National Park
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, known for its rich biodiversity and stunning views of Mount Khangchendzonga.

name: Ooty
description: A hill station known for its pleasant climate, tea gardens, and lush landscapes.

name: Nainital
description: A beautiful hill station known for its scenic lake and the surrounding mountains.
